Bison Steak with Mushrooms

This dish tastes great with Wild Rice and Cranberry Pilaf as a side.  Serves 4.

 

Rub:

1 1/2 tsp finely chopped fresh rosemary

2 tsp packed brown sugar

1 1/2 tsp coarse ground pepper

3 cloves garlic, minced

1/2 tsp sea salt

8 juniper berries, crushed (optional)

1/4 tsp cayenne pepper

olive oil

 

Steaks:

2 tsp olive oil

4 (6 oz) bison steaks (sirloin, ribeye, striploin or tenderloin)

Mix all the rub ingredients together and add enough oil to make a thin paste.  Rub the mixture over the steaks and allow to marinate for 20 minutes.   Heat the 2 tsp olive oil in a heavy pan over medium high heat.  When hot, add steaks and sear 5-8 minutes for medium rare, or until desired doneness, turning over halfway through cooking.  Remove from heat and cover with foil.

 

Mushroom Ragout:

1 tbs olive oil

1 tbs butter

1 garlic clove, minced

2 shallots, finely chopped

1 1/2 lbs mixed mushrooms (Chanterelle, lobster, Shitake, oyster, Crimini), stemmed, thinly sliced

1 tsp finely chopped fresh thyme

1/4 c Madeira or Marsala wine

1/4 c veal broth or beef broth

1/2 c whipping cream

salt and freshly ground pepper

2 tbs coarsely chopped fresh Italian parsley

Saute shallots, and mushrooms in same pan from steak.  Add fresh thyme, wine and broth.  Simmer for a few minutes.  Stir in whipping cream until heated and salt and pepper to taste. 

 

Serve bison steak with mushrooms spooned on top and garnished with fresh parsley.
